entry.title: Thanks
entry.summary: I wish it didn't take a scare once in a while…
entry.content:
I wish it didn't take a scare once in a while to remember how lucky and blessed you are.

I wish it didn't, but sometimes it does.

A jolt back into reality.

A wake-up call.

A near miss.

The more susceptible you are to danger, the more you realize how much plain ol' luck has to do with it.

Just wasn't my day to go.

Dodged a bullet.

You could credit skill, but I ain't Neo.

Better to be lucky than great.

But not better than good.

Good still beats luck.

It's just sometimes, luck survives, and good don't.

To the unlucky good. Just wasn't your day. 

Time to go.

May you rise, once more.

Good luck.

Signed,

One lucky mf.

entry.title: Wisdom
entry.summary: As I've said before, I'm currently in an absurd phase. I'm…
entry.content:
As I've said before, I'm currently in an absurd phase.

I'm going for absurd.

As an underachieving, overachieving Asian going for absurd, there is always motivation in insults.

So here's an absurd motivational insult to put in your pocket while you pursue the meaning of life:

Don't be wisdumb, be wissmart!

...

I'll see myself out.

entry.title: The Way of Other Ways
entry.summary: As a self-proclaimed martial artist of little to no renown, I…
entry.content:
As a self-proclaimed martial artist of little to no renown, I seek the Way.

How do I define the Way?

When Bruce Lee first taught in America, the old Chinese grandmasters had a problem with it.

For lots of reasons, but for two main ones:

1) He taught others besides (but including) Chinese people.

2) He taught more than one way.

Bruce came to the conclusion that you study and practice all arts, adding what is useful and discarding what is not. In martial and other arts.

But old folks (especially Chinese grandmasters) are stuck in their ways.

In their Way.

There are no other Ways.

Just one.

Of course, this is just old people trying to protect older ideas.

In an era where nothing is sacred (always the present), they wanted to keep something so (always the past).

Change is scary.

Change is unknown.

Change is future.

But the thing about chasing other Ways is that you aren't disrespecting, you are being the most respectful. 

How do you know the strengths of your beliefs if they are never tested?

If you don't seek other Ways?

Belief must be tested.

After all you have gone through, after all you are going through, and after all you will go through, what will you still believe?

What has stayed the same?

What has changed?

What should change?

Seek and try other Ways.

As many as you can.

Test it against your status quo.

Keep what works.

Discard the rest.

Treasure what works.

Throw away what does not.

Throw away what does not!

THROW AWAY WHAT DOES NOT!

Most of us know what to keep.

It's knowing what to throw away that you keep hanging onto, that's the killer.

There are other Ways.

This is mine.

entry.title: Ivory and Gold
entry.summary: Today is a very special day. I won't say why because…
entry.content:
Today is a very special day.

I won't say why because some things are just for me.

I always thought I would end up alone on some mountain top in rural Korea.

Contemplating and striking the air and wooden things.

You know, monk type ess.

And I suppose there is a universe where I am doing just that.

But not this one.

In this one, I have to nurture and love ivory and two precious mixtures of ivory and gold.

Yes, they all drive me crazy, but I suppose everything I have ever loved does.

So alas, my mountain top is digital.

My alone is in brief pockets of time. 

I am the richest man in the world.

A hermit with a fortune.

Just like I dreamed.

entry.title: Treasure Chaser
entry.summary: Are your memories treasure? Or are your visions of the future…
entry.content:
Are your memories treasure?

Or are your visions of the future the treasure?

What about the present?

Is right now considered a treasure?

They all seem pretty valuable.

Treasure hunters are an interesting group.

Chasing futures where they hope to find the valued past right now or somewhat soonish.

Someone's past, found in someone else's present, for yet another someone else's future.

Actually finding the treasure comes with all sorts of drama (like all big moments).

You may not even be able to keep it.

The law, ya know.

Ahh, but the chase is yours.

They can't take that away, right?

Right?

Did they take that away?

How big is your fortune?

Is it vaulted in your heart?

Is it in the cloud in your brain?

Or can you touch it with your lips?

Are you the treasure?

Yours or anyone else's?

Somewhere between remembering and imagining is present day.

Vault, earth, cloud.

I'd say carpe diem or some ess, but I hear they cancelled Latin.

Sic Transit Gloria.

entry.title: Timelines
entry.summary: I almost forgot to write again. Some days just fly by.
entry.content:
I almost forgot to write again.

Some days just fly by.

Most days do.

As you get older, the seconds, minutes, hours, and days just seem a bit shorter.

Even the microwave timer I set for a few comfortable minutes seems to take me by surprise.

Already? I thought I had more time.

Kids never want the day to end.

They can spend an eternity in a day and still want it to last a little longer.

My little ones are how I measure time now.

I don't feel old.

I just act it.

Always have.

But when I see how big they're getting, well, do the math.

This is a very wonderful season. In the year. Of my life.

If you don't know by now, I believe time is the truest and most precious currency. 

And attention is how we pay.

Are you paying attention to how you spend your time?

Tick tock. 

Ever wonder why they call the app that?

entry.title: Guano
entry.summary: Ever hear the idea that insanity is doing the same thing…
entry.content:
Ever hear the idea that insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different result?

This is a mostly true statement.

But there are always exceptions to every rule. Exceptions so few that they prove the rule.

For example, do you know how they split really big rocks?

One person grabs a big hammer.

Said person smashes said hammer on big rock. 

It does nothing.

They smash it again in the same spot.

Over and over again.

Expecting it to crack.

It doesn't.

Not right away.

They just keep smacking the rock.

Same spot.

Over and over.

The key is patience. And knowing where and how to strike.

They just keep smashing away.

Then you know what happens?

After a long time, and a lot of reps, the rock just suddenly splits.

A bat ess crazy person probably discovered this.

So, for your consideration:

What are you doing, over and over, expecting a different result?

And are you splitting a rock or swinging at a shadow?

Three feet from gold or digging your own grave?

Find good hammer.

Find good rock. 

Find right spot to smash.

Smash rock in right spot.

Over and over.

Nothing happens.

Keep going.

Rock splits.

Good work.

Good rock.

Good human.

Next rock...

entry.title: Once Upon A Time
entry.summary: I'm just happy to be here. I know sometimes it's not…
entry.content:
I'm just happy to be here.

I know sometimes it's not clear.

That's the old curmudgeon in me.

But I've always been this way.

Right now, all of this, every single ridiculous post, is me reeling from the reality of how a man who plays the long game almost passes, but survives.

Lives to fight another day.

A most fortunate man.

How do you keep thinking and planning the future when you're just enjoying, and grateful for, today?

I tell those closest to me that I'm in my absurd phase.

I'm going for absurd.

It seems like a fun way to play it.

All of this, after all, is the stuff of fairy tales.

Magic and wonder.

I sit in awe of it all.

But if I'm not the same, the next question is, "Who in the world am I?" Ah! That's the great puzzle!

And they lived happily ever after.

entry.title: The End
entry.summary: You ever stick to something, just because you wanted to see…
entry.content:
You ever stick to something, just because you wanted to see how it ends?

Be it a book, a game, a movie, a tv show, a job?

Why do we do that?

Some sort of closure is needed. 

Even if you know it'll disappoint.

I'd like to think that wisdom is in knowing what to finish and what to just stop.

What is worth finishing?

What is worth stopping?

Oh, and don't worry.

I am still going to write here.

Just getting started.

entry.title: The Answer
entry.summary: You know what your problem is? I think that's a fine…
entry.content:
You know what your problem is?

I think that's a fine way to start a sentence.

But you better come correct with the follow-up.

Well, do you?

Hmm?

Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm?

Yeah, heck if I know.

No gurus here.

Figure it out.
